title: Installation issue: boost%nvhpc
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install boost@1.76.0%nvhpc@21.5
...
==> Installing boost-1.76.0-egxydhpfoggdbo6iob76xudt3sysrxcl
==> No binary for boost-1.76.0-egxydhpfoggdbo6iob76xudt3sysrxcl found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/f0/f0397ba6e982c4450f27bf32a2a83292aba035b827a5623a14636ea583318c41.tar.bz2
3 out of 3 hunks FAILED -- saving rejects to file tools/build/src/engine/build.sh.rej
==> Patch /spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/boost/nvhpc.patch failed.
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/usr/bin/patch' '-s' '-p' '1' '-i' '/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/boost/nvhpc.patch' '-d' '.'
```
It appears that the `nvhpc.patch` added by @samcmill to override the PGI configuration in  `tools/build/src/engine/build.sh` with nvhpc compilers is out of date. It would be nice if this configuration was supported natively.

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3241-1bccd866ae
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-power9le
* **Concretizer:** original

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information
* [build.sh.rej.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6703622/build.sh.rej.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
